column4: Any way to get my Ubuntu installation in english, and make it use a norwegian keyset?
Because the norwegian translation in ubuntu is a mix of english, danish, swedish and norwegian.. :o
And when i type the norwegian characters in x-chat.. i see them.. but other's see them as gibberish..
i think you can choose a different keyboard layout under System -> preferences -> keyboard preferences
i see two norwegian keyboard layouts there
third one is an a with a circle over it
second circle with a slash. the first a melded into e
might be. what does 'file <filename>' tell you?
have you tried installing the ubuntu provided drivers?
read that wiki page for more info
look under system -> preferences -> keyboard shortcuts
you can enable some stuff (volume control, e.g.) there
thanks.. do you know any media players that supports the "next/previous track" shortcut? Cause xmms doesnt.
ok, ill try it out. Thanks again :)
